text:
*[Bug 18892] Support the use of netrc when using the libcurl downloader?*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18892>

--- Comment #11 from Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) ---
(In reply to Eric Lindblad from comment #10)
Implementing a system-wide alternative to the cache of available packages would
be difficult to get right. The challenges would include synchronization and
race conditions, security, privacy (like here discussed private package
repositories), supporting different OSes, and then indeed maintenance of all of
that. I don't think it would be worth the effort. One can set up a local CRAN
mirror to deal with the latency of downloading the list of available packages
(and indeed also downloading the individual packages), and this is already well
supported and documented.

text:
*[Bug 18911] cleanup tcltk*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18911>

--- Comment #1 from Eric Lindblad (<mailto:lindblad@gmx.com|lindblad@gmx.com>) ---
In addition to fixes the in the patch here's another fix.

```
$ sed -i "s/unkown/unknown/g" src/library/tcltk/exec/hierarchy.tcl
$ 
```
